question.text: What is the correct sequence in breeding a new genetic variety of crop?

options.text: Cross hybridization  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Collection of variability  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Testing of superior recombinants  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Commercialisation of new cultivars
Collection of variability  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Cross hybridization  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Testing of superior recombinants  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Commercialisation of new cultivars
Collection of variability  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Testing of superior recombinants  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Cross hybridization  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Commercialisation of new cultivars
Cross hybridization  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Testing of superior recombinants  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Collection of variability  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Commercialisation of new cultivars

solution.text: Collection of variability is the first step. Then parents are selected and crossed. The superior varieties from the offspring are selected and tested. The final variety is selected and commercialized.
